stars.name: Sun
stars.fact: It accounts for 99.8% of the solar system’s mass.

stars.name: Betelgeuse
stars.fact: It would engulf Jupiter’s orbit if placed at the Sun’s position.

stars.name: Sirius
stars.fact: It's the brightest star in the night sky.

stars.name: Proxima Centauri
stars.fact: The closest star to Earth after the Sun.

planets.name: Earth
planets.fact: The only planet known to support life.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.fact: Its Great Red Spot is a centuries-old storm.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.fact: Its rings are thin and mostly made of ice.

planets.name: Venus
planets.fact: It rotates in the opposite direction to most planets.

moons.name: Moon
moons.fact: It moves 3.8 cm away from Earth each year.

moons.name: Titan
moons.fact: It has methane lakes and a thick atmosphere.

moons.name: Europa
moons.fact: It likely has a subsurface ocean.

moons.name: Phobos
moons.fact: It may crash into Mars or break into a ring.

comets.name: Halley’s Comet
comets.fact: Visible to the naked eye every 76 years.

asteroids.name: Ceres
asteroids.fact: May have briny water under its surface.

asteroids.name: Vesta
asteroids.fact: One of the most massive and round asteroids.

asteroids.name: Apophis
asteroids.fact: Once feared to hit Earth in 2029.

dwarfPlanets.name: Pluto
dwarfPlanets.fact: Has five moons and a heart-shaped glacier.

dwarfPlanets.name: Haumea
dwarfPlanets.fact: Shaped like an egg and spins fast.

others.name: Sagittarius A*
others.fact: At the center of the Milky Way.

others.name: Andromeda Galaxy
others.fact: Will collide with the Milky Way in 4 billion years.

others.name: Crab Nebula
others.fact: Formed from an explosion seen in 1054 AD.
